src:
若冲の初期作品発見、３０代で手掛けた彩色画か

05 Nov 2019, 13:00



伊藤若冲の３０歳代の頃の作品とみられる「蕪に双鶏図」（京都市右京区の福田美術館で）

　江戸時代中期に活躍した絵師・伊藤若冲（じゃくちゅう）（１７１６～１８００年）が３０歳代で手がけたとみられる彩色画「蕪（かぶ）に双鶏図（そうけいず）」が見つかったと５日、収蔵する京都市の福田美術館が発表した。これまで存在が知られていない作品で、専門家は「若冲の初期作品は数点しかなく、後の代表作の特徴がうかがえる貴重な発見」としている。
　若冲は主に動植物を描き、３０歳代には「景和（けいわ）」を名乗ったとされる。代表作に４０歳代で制作した極彩色の「動植綵絵（どうしょくさいえ）」がある。
　今回見つかった作品は縦１・１１メートル、横０・６８メートル。首を下に向けた鶏の雄と、うずくまった雌の周りに葉が傷んだカブが描かれている。
　関西在住の所有者の依頼で鑑定したところ、若冲の最初期の作品とされる「雪中雄鶏図（ゆうけいず）」（細見美術館蔵）と同じ景和の印章があることや、鶏の羽の精密な表現などから、初期作品と推定された。福田美術館の岡田秀之学芸課長は「雪中雄鶏図に比べ、色遣いや地面の表現などにやや未熟さがあり、さらに若い時期の作品かもしれない」としている。
　彩色画は来年３月２０日に同館で始まる特別展で展示する。
　美術史家・辻惟雄さんの話「手慣れた筆致で鶏を描いている一方、カブの葉などは懸命に写生したような初々しさがのぞく。葉が鳥に見えるだまし絵の要素もあり、動植綵絵の原型が詰まった重要な発見だ」

Wakatsuki's early works discovered, painted in his 30s

05 Nov 2019, 13:00



Ito Wakatsuki's work in his thirties, “Two chickens in a bowl” (in Fukuda Museum of Art, Ukyo-ku, Kyoto)

The painter Jakuchu (1716-1800), who was active in the middle of the Edo period, found a color painting that was thought to have been handled in his thirties by his “Kabu”. On the 5th, the Fukuda Museum of Art in Kyoto City, where it was stored, announced. A work that has not been known so far, the expert says, "There are only a few Wakatsuki's early works, and a valuable discovery that reveals the characteristics of later representative works."
Wakatsuki draws mainly flora and fauna, and is said to have named “Keiwa” in his 30s. One of his most famous works is the colorfully colored “Animated Paintings” produced in his 40s.
[This work was found to be 1.11 meters long and 0.668 meters wide. A chicken with its neck down and a turnip with wounded leaves around a crouched female.
An appraisal was made at the request of the owner who lives in Kansai, and there was a seal of the same peace as “Yukikeizu” (Hosomi Museum Collection), which is the first work of Wakatsuki. It was presumed to be an early work from the precise expression of the wings. Hideyuki Okada, director of the Fukuda Museum of Art, says, “It is somewhat immature in terms of coloring and ground expression compared to the rooster figure in snow, and it may be a work at a younger time.”
Color paintings will be exhibited at a special exhibition starting in the same building on March 20 next year.
Story of art historian Tatsuo “While drawing chicken with familiar brushstrokes, the leaves of the turnip etc. look like the originality of a hard copy. There are also elements of tricks that make the leaves look like birds. It's an important discovery packed with prototypes of moving paintings. ''
